result.execSummary:
The defendant Azalea Joy Roberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With Huber release privileges to be determined by HOC.
Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 09/07/2022.

miscConds.notes:
Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

No contact with JLC unless approved by the court.
No contact with firearms.

Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.
Court set restitution at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Azalea Joy Roberts

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Azalea Joy Roberts appeared by video.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz appeared by video for Azalea Joy Roberts.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Sentencing hearing. 

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with Huber release privileges to be determined by HOC, with credit for 4 days served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Court set restitution at zero.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with JLC unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- Defendant to pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply if applicable.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 09/07/2022.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Received and Filed. NOTICE OF RIGHT TO SEEK POSTCONVICTION RELIEF
Received and Filed. NOTICE OF RIGHT TO SEEK POSTCONVICTION RELIEF

Defendant Azalea Joy Roberts in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court STRIKES the Use of a Dangerous Weapon Enhancer in Count 1.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Case adjourned to Branch 29 for Sentencing.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da

Defendant Azalea Joy Roberts in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a jury trial. Defense counsel advises the Court of a resolution. Court passes case.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Azalea Joy Roberts in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Final pre-trial held. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 6/27/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
Defendant's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Azalea Joy Roberts in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests the no contact order be modified. Court DENIES the request.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29. This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Azalea Joy Roberts in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a bail/bond hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests an adjourned bail/bond hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JLC.

Defendant Azalea Joy Roberts in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.
  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/17/22 @ 1p
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
